body_html:
Do the following:

conda update libgcc

but this will require downgrading "due to dependency conflicts" next time you update anaconda.

OR
you can mask the anaconda libstdc++ so that your system's libstdc++ is used

cd ~/TO-YOUR-ANACONDA-FOLDER/lib
mv libstdc++.so libstdc++.so.bkp
mv libstdc++.so.6 libstdc++.so.6.bkp

Further optionally create a softlink inside the anaconda lib directly

ln -s /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6 libstdc++.so.6
body_text:
Do the following:
conda update libgcc
but this will require downgrading "due to dependency conflicts" next time you update anaconda.
OR
you can mask the anaconda libstdc++ so that your system's libstdc++ is used
cd ~/TO-YOUR-ANACONDA-FOLDER/lib
mv libstdc++.so libstdc++.so.bkp
mv libstdc++.so.6 libstdc++.so.6.bkp

Further optionally create a softlink inside the anaconda lib directly
ln -s /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6 libstdc++.so.6
body:
Do the following:

`conda update libgcc`

but this will require downgrading "due to dependency conflicts" next time you update anaconda.

OR
 you can mask the anaconda libstdc++ so that your system's libstdc++ is used
```
cd ~/TO-YOUR-ANACONDA-FOLDER/lib
mv libstdc++.so libstdc++.so.bkp
mv libstdc++.so.6 libstdc++.so.6.bkp
```
Further optionally create a softlink inside the anaconda lib directly

`ln -s /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6 libstdc++.so.6`
